content: grapes of wrap updated 10/5/19 by jen baker pattern row 1 chain 3 2 double_crochet in 3rd chain from the hook turn row 2 chain 2 double_crochet in first stitch 2dc in last stitch turn increasing row = 3 stitches row 3 chain 2 double_crochet across turn = 3 stitches row 4 chain 2 double_crochet across with 2dc in last stitch turn increasing row = 4 stitches ~ repeat row #3 and #4 until you have a stitch count of 19 stitches should be 31 row ~ row 32 chain 2 double_crochet+1 chain in first stitch skip next stitch repeat across do not increase on this row turn row 33 repeat row #2 & #3 & #2 in that order so that you continue to increase on the correct side and have three solid double_crochet row between your double_crochet+1 chain row continue these four row #32 #2 #3 #2 until you hit the mid-point of your yarn if you ve measured the weight give yourself a couple grams of wiggle room you don t want to be short at the mid-point continue the 4 row pattern but decrease at the end of the row on the increase side which will now become your decrease side remember to mark it with a stitch marker you will now decrease by one stitch every other row when only 19 stitches remain discontinue the double_crochet+1 row and end the final row in all double_crochet should be about 32 row continue to decrease every other row on the decreasing side until you have one final stitch bind off weave in ends and enjoy your scarf i look forward to seeing your creations please use #grapesofwrap or tag me on instagram at @thejenbaker so i can see yours online
